item.title: Notes: Where Good Ideas Come From
item.description: References Citekey: @johnson2010 Johnson, S. (2010). Where Good Ideas Come From: The Natural History of Innovation. Riverhead Hardcover. Notes Resources from this book Howard Gruber, who studied Darwin’s notebook2. Antonio Damasio, who studied brain-damaged patients whose inability to make intuitive snap judgments Malcolm Gladwell’s bestseller Blink focused on instant hunch Darwin’s Paradox In Darwin’s own words, stumbling across the ecosystem of a coral reef in the middle of an ocean was like encountering a swarming oasis in the middle of a desert.
